title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 06 February 2014 - XWiki
content:
<polx> has joined #xwiki  
00:22 <ansuz> has joined #xwiki  
00:44 <abusenius> has quit  
01:35 <ansuz> has quit  
02:21 <polx> has quit  
02:37 <ansuz> has joined #xwiki  
02:39 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
06:04 <Denis> has quit  
07:15 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
07:20 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:22 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
07:38 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:46 <msmeria> has quit  
07:46 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:47 <vrachieru> has joined #xwiki  
07:57 <polx> has quit  
08:56 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:11 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:24 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:31 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:12 <sdumitriu> has quit  
10:15 <vmassol> hi guys  
10:15 <vmassol> docker is really cool. I'll investigate a bit more and make a proposal soon on the list on how we could use it  
10:19 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:26 <vmassol> tmortagne: you forgot to move the 5.4 roadmap page, doing it  
10:28 <vmassol> creating roadmap skeleto for 6.x at the same time  
10:45 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
10:48 <evalica> has quit  
10:48 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:56 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
10:58 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
11:14 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:30 <kaisen> has joined #xwiki  
11:32 <kaisen> Hello, I just updaged my 5.2.2 to 5.4. It runs well so far (instead of 5.3) As you improve the Subwiki feature I'll tried it again. Now it seems also to work in standard as I expect. Beside one point. If I remove view rights from unregisterd users in my subwiki I also cannot access my "parent" wiki without login.  
11:33 <kaisen> In the "parent" Wiki the unregisterd users have the right to view the wiki  
11:33 <gdelhumeau> really?  
11:38 <kaisen> I just did it once. I will now double check wiht a vanilla 5.4 Installation. Just will take some time.  
11:40 <gdelhumeau> I am checking too  
11:42 <gdelhumeau> damn your are right  
11:42 <gdelhumeau> Denis: do you have an idea?  
11:43 <GuillaumeF> has joined #xwiki  
11:53 <Denis> gdelhumeau, kaisen: I reproduce, and it does not look to be a cache issue, I am digging…  
11:54 <kaisen> Thanks, I just want to mention it as maybe others already using subwikis  
11:55 <Denis> seems an issue with the way we remove the rights, since I do not see the right anymore at the main wiki after a restart !  
11:56 <Denis> forgive me  
11:56 <Denis> I got again confused by the new interface, it going to make crazy  
11:56 <Denis> +me  
11:58 <kaisen> Not shure what you mean with it removes after a restart.  
11:59 <kaisen> If I restart the tomcat the settings are like before the restart  
12:00 <Denis> I just said you should forgive me, I had been tricked by the new interface  
12:01 <Denis> I really do not like that new interface, it is far too easy to confuse the main and the subwiki admin  
12:01 <kaisen> No Problem, I can't fix it anyway so I will never be sad with someone that can :)  
12:01 <Denis> it happen to me all the time, which means there is a ergonomic issue  
12:02 <kaisen> You mean the top menu to administrate the wiki and subwiki?  
12:02 <Denis> yep  
12:02 <kaisen> Don't work much with it so I cannot say something to it  
12:02 <kaisen> I will be off for 1 h  
12:03 <Denis> I will probably need it to find an explanation (at least)  
12:05 <Denis> curiously the blog or the sandbox stay accessible  
12:07 <vmassol> evalica: hi  
12:07 <evalica> vmassol: hi  
12:07 <vmassol> I don't understand why you point the following issue as confidential  
12:07 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-4248  
12:07 <evalica> well it had the label security …  
12:08 <evalica> I noticed that we have issues on Security component, on field Security and on label Security - I was thinking of grouping them somehow in order to be easily findable by Denis  
12:08 <vmassol> easy way is security label  
12:08 <vmassol> confidential means other shold not see it  
12:08 <vmassol> it odesn't mean securit  
12:08 <vmassol> signed scripts  
12:08 <vmassol> is about security  
12:08 <evalica> well shouldn't all Security items be confidential?  
12:08 <vmassol> but it should definitley not be confidential  
12:08 <vmassol> no no  
12:09 <vmassol> as I explained  
12:09 <vmassol> completelyt different matters  
12:09 <vmassol> again  
12:09 <evalica> but all confidential should be security? :)  
12:09 <vmassol> confidential means the issue is not viewable  
12:09 <Denis> and security module means the security module in platform, and not everything about security  
12:09 <vmassol> maybe maybe not  
12:10 <evalica> hmm than maybe Denis can label them properly - since there are 220+ items that I wanted to label as security .. but I will stop  
12:10 <vmassol> could you remove the confidential you added?  
12:11 <evalica> k  
12:11 <vmassol> thanks  
12:11 <Denis> gdelhumeau, kaisen: seems only Main.WebHome is affected  
12:11 <evalica> I want to organize JIRA :) somehow … but … I make mistakes when I make assumations and I don't want to take issues one by one  
12:14 <gdelhumeau> Denis: could it be related to XWIKI-10016 ?  
12:15 <vmassol> evalica: and thanks for helping out  
12:15 <vmassol> don't stop trying :)  
12:15 <evalica> :)  
12:15 <vmassol> you could ask before doing stuff though  
12:16 <vmassol> in case you want to be on the safe side  
12:16 <evalica> :) trust me you don't want that  … and I won't do it anyway - except if I do something really bad  
12:16 <vmassol> often I've noticed that you start doing stuff without discussing it  
12:17 <vmassol> just a simple one liner mention that you're going to do XXX on irc could be good  
12:17 <vmassol> and allow someone to comment if he thinks there's a problem  
12:17 <evalica> well :) I'm going to try to find bugs today :)  
12:17 <Denis> gdelhumeau: no, it cannot, XWIKI-10016 looks like a cache issue  
12:18 <vmassol> evalica: yep, I need to start too, have been doing paper work all morning  
12:36 <evalica> gdelhumeau: maybe you'll want to close XWIKI-8600  
12:46 <vmassol> evalica: I don't understand http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-6353  
12:46 <vmassol> we don't want to write it in Groovy but in Java  
12:47 <evalica> vmassol: I closed it as Won't fix. You reopened it. I removed my self, since is no longer fixed.  
12:47 <evalica> \*closed  
12:47 <vmassol> fixing my comment because I don't agree with it :)  
12:48 <evalica> so I can close it or not? :)  
12:51 <vmassol> has quit  
12:52 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
12:52 <vmassol> evalica: you can close it  
12:52 <vmassol> sorry about the mixup  
12:52 <evalica> np  
12:52 <evalica> thanks  
12:52 <vmassol> I'm still unsure why I replied that  
12:52 <vmassol> :)  
12:52 <vmassol> maybe I replied to the wrong issue....  
13:24 <Denis> has quit  
13:25 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
13:34 <gdelhumeau> evalica: about XWIKI-8600, I have still an old pull request that I need to improve to close it  
13:38 <evalica> k - I though you just needed to apply it  
14:12 <vmassol> tmortagne: I have a problem on 6.0SNAPSHOT when exporting to XAR  
14:13 <vmassol> I modified a page and exported it in order to commit it  
14:13 <vmassol> and when I do a diff I get:  
14:13 <vmassol> ${escapetool.  
14:14 <vmassol> oops  
14:14 <vmassol> https://www.evernote.com/shard/s119/sh/dbf91172-37f6-4569-a12f-144f794d5bd7/de458dd55973306356762a399df68ad3  
14:14 <vmassol> lots of  at end of lines + > have disappeared  
14:16 <gdelhumeau> it has been there for a few weeks  
14:16 <vmassol> wdym?  
14:16 <gdelhumeau> I have reported this on IRC a few weeks ago  
14:16 <vmassol> are you saying that we've released a 5.4 with a blocker?  
14:16 <vmassol> :(  
14:16 <gdelhumeau> it's not a blocker  
14:16 <vmassol> or it's only on master  
14:16 <vmassol> not a blocker????????  
14:16 <vmassol> you kidding me?  
14:16 <vmassol> check my diff  
14:16 <gdelhumeau> your XAR is broken ?  
14:17 <vmassol> it cannot work  
14:17 <vmassol> of course it's broken  
14:17 <gdelhumeau> you cannot import it?  
14:17 <vmassol> it has missing >  
14:17 <Slashman> has quit  
14:17 <vmassol> check my diff  
14:17 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne told me it was not necessary to escape them  
14:18 <gdelhumeau> as long as < are escaped  
14:18 <vmassol> you're saying one thing and it's opposite in the same sentence :)  
14:18 <vmassol> of course you need to escape xml reserved chars  
14:18 <gdelhumeau> no  
14:18 <gdelhumeau> you talk about >  
14:18 <vmassol> have you checked my diff?  
14:18 <vmassol> "lots of  at end of lines + > have disappeared"  
14:19 <gdelhumeau> I have the same at home  
14:19 <vmassol> explain to me how the removal of > (i.e. '>') can work?  
14:19 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: try to import it  
14:19 <vmassol> I don't care  
14:19 <vmassol> it's broken  
14:19 <tmortagne> vmassol: > desapeared is actually an improvement  
14:19 <vmassol> what?  
14:19 <tmortagne> as for the  I don't know  
14:19 <gdelhumeau> > can't close anything if < are escaped  
14:20 <tmortagne> vmassol: escaping > is not needed in XML  
14:20 <vmassol> it's not even about escaping or not escaping  
14:20 <vmassol> they're removed  
14:20 <vmassol> altoegther  
14:20 <gdelhumeau> no  
14:20 <gdelhumeau> there is > instead  
14:20 <tmortagne> of course not  
14:20 <vmassol> ah no  
14:20 <vmassol> you unescaped them  
14:21 <vmassol> ok my bad I didn't see the ">" was added  
14:21 <vmassol> now remains the other issue  
14:21 <tmortagne> I did not unescaped them, the standrad Stax writer does not escape them because it's useless that's all  
14:21 <vmassol> the   
14:21 <tmortagne>  is \r IIRW  
14:21 <vmassol> is it normal that we now have extra \r everywhere?  
14:22 <vmassol> that's what you changed I guess  
14:22 <tmortagne> which mean you have \r\n line ending in your content for some reason  
14:22 <tmortagne> I actually did the opposite AFAIK...  
14:22 <tmortagne> ha no  
14:22 <tmortagne> it's still in a branch  
14:22 <vmassol> btw this broke the formatmojo  
14:22 <tmortagne> I did not touched anything on that  
14:23 <gdelhumeau> every time I use diff, I replace all  before  
14:23 <gdelhumeau> but it is a pain  
14:23 <tmortagne> in any case it's not nice but it's not a blocker in any way  
14:23 <vmassol> before?  
14:23 <tmortagne> and it's not new having \r in document dontent  
14:23 <tmortagne> content  
14:23 <gdelhumeau> before doing the diff  
14:23 <vmassol> it's the first time I see them tmortagne  
14:23 <vmassol> it's new to me  
14:23 <vmassol> and I've checked lots of xml files in xwiki  
14:23 <vmassol> they don't have that  
14:23 <tmortagne> vmassol: maybe your browser behavior changed then  
14:24 <vmassol> can you try on your side?  
14:24 <vmassol> on 6.0SNAPSHOT  
14:24 <gdelhumeau> I have the case when I export edited files from firefox/gedit with the it's all text extension  
14:24 <vmassol> I use chrome  
14:24 <vmassol> tmortagne: why do you say it's not a blocker?  
14:25 <vmassol> will they get removed at import?  
14:25 <tmortagne> vmassol: why would it bea a blocker ?  
14:25 <tmortagne> you get \r\n in document content  
14:25 <vmassol> because it changes the contnet  
14:25 <tmortagne> how is it an issue since that's what you get when you edit a document from the UI most of the tile  
14:25 <tmortagne> no it does not change the content, not from XAR point of view  
14:25 <tmortagne> it actually export exactly the content you have  
14:25 <vmassol> from XAR it does for sure, from XWiki maybe not  
14:26 <tmortagne> which mean keeping the \r  
14:26 <tmortagne> vmassol: no from XAR it does not  
14:26 <vmassol> if I cmmmit now you'll get a diff for things I \*\*\*didn't\*\*\* change  
14:26 <tmortagne> all XAR knows if that here you hae some String content  
14:26 <vmassol> so this means it changes the XAR  
14:27 <vmassol> said diffrently if I check the XAR size it's not going to be the same  
14:27 <vmassol> so it does change the XAR  
14:27 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: that is why I remove every  before commiting  
14:27 <vmassol> yes gdelhumeau and this is why I don't understand why tmortagne says it'es not a problem  
14:27 <vmassol> and that it doesn't change the XAR  
14:27 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: amso the > thing changes the size  
14:27 <gdelhumeau> \*also  
14:28 <vmassol> yes sure that's nother matter  
14:28 <vmassol> don't confuse stuff more :)  
14:28 <tmortagne> again I never said it's right, I said it's far from a blocker because it does not change anything from XWiki point of view  
14:28 <tmortagne> or even from XAR point of view  
14:28 <gdelhumeau> the fact that it changes the size is not a problem from my point of view, that is all  
14:28 <tmortagne> it's a XML, having   or \r is exactly the same thing for a XL reader  
14:28 <tmortagne> /XL/XML/  
14:29 <tmortagne> and having \n in document content is not something recent  
14:29 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: you're wrong it is a problem  
14:29 <tmortagne> I don't know why suddently the standard XML writer started escaping \r but it's not really something at wikistream level  
14:29 <vmassol> tmortagne: so this comes from stax?  
14:30 <gdelhumeau> then everytime you add a metadata in the xml file, it will be a problem too  
14:30 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: of course  
14:30 <vmassol> you break backward compat if you do this  
14:30 <tmortagne> vmassol: all we do is sending the content as it is and whatever stax writer triggered write it  
14:30 <vmassol> so we should check stax config options for serialization  
14:30 <tmortagne> so the default stax writer changed at least for you or you used to never have \r in your contents  
14:31 <vmassol> it's not just me tmortagne  
14:31 <tmortagne> nothing to do with configuration, there is no configuration for this  
14:31 <vmassol> I don't see any \r in any of our xml files  
14:31 <vmassol> tmortagne: we use DOM4J or jdom and they do have config options for serialiing xml  
14:31 <vmassol> so I expect stax to be the same  
14:31 <tmortagne> not for this and no we don't use dom4j or jdom for stax  
14:32 <tmortagne> there is no configuration saying "please don't escape \r"  
14:32 <tmortagne> so it's certainly not what changed  
14:32 <tmortagne> sounds more like a new dependency ovewriting the default stax writer  
14:34 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
14:36 <vmassol> tmortagne: what api are you using for serializing the xml?  
14:36 <tmortagne> vmassol: stax  
14:36 <vmassol> it has 2 apis AFICS  
14:37 <vmassol> cursor api and another one  
14:37 <tmortagne> you have an event based and a call based interfaces but I doubt they use different way of serializing XML...  
14:37 <vmassol> could you point me to our code?  
14:37 <tmortagne> XAR module use XMLStreamWriter  
14:38 <vmassol> tmortagne: public void setNewLine(String newLine) {  
14:38 <vmassol> on IndentingXMLStreamWriter  
14:39 <tmortagne> org.xwiki.wikistream.xar.internal.output.XAROutputWikiStream  
14:39 <vmassol> ah that's when format is true and I guess it's false for export xar  
14:39 <tmortagne> nothing to do with what we are talking about  
14:39 <tmortagne> IndentingXMLStreamWriter as its name suggest is about formatting  
14:39 <vmassol> yes and it handles newlines  
14:39 <tmortagne> even if it was true  
14:39 <tmortagne> it's not the point  
14:39 <tmortagne> it's not used for the content inside an element  
14:39 <vmassol> indeed it's the content element  
14:40 <tmortagne> here we are not really talking about newline  
14:40 <tmortagne> the writer just what what you ask  
14:40 <vmassol> yes since it's not done on the xml element it means it's not coming from the serializer  
14:40 <tmortagne> and in the content you have the characters \r and \n  
14:41 <tmortagne> of course the \r does not come for the serializer  
14:41 <vmassol> so you're sure you didn't change anything in our code on master reagrding new lines?  
14:41 <tmortagne> I keep repeating that document content have \r\n  
14:41 <vmassol> yes, the question is why  
14:41 <tmortagne> the XAR export does not touch in any way the content  
14:41 <vmassol> and it's not coming from my browser  
14:41 <tmortagne> what do you mean why ?  
14:41 <tmortagne> it's like that since forever  
14:42 <tmortagne> the only thiing that changed here is that \r is escaped  
14:42 <vmassol> so you're saying that all our other docs ahve \r but I just don't see it becuase my ide doesn't show it?  
14:42 <tmortagne> you are mixing several things, of course your browser send a \r, that's the standard  
14:42 <vmassol> checking  
14:43 <tmortagne> then the XML writer write aither \r or   
14:43 <tmortagne> but then if it's \r git remove it automatically because it's inconsistent AFAIK  
14:43 <tmortagne> but it's probably possible to find some with it in very old documents  
14:44 <tmortagne> when it's  git does not treat it as a line ending  
14:44 <tmortagne> because it does not really know it's XML  
14:45 <vmassol> so you're saying that the change is that now stax replaces \r with   
14:45 <vmassol> right?  
14:46 <tmortagne> yes  
14:46 <tmortagne> AFAIK be have several dependencies that overwrite the standard stax writer but I don't know what makes one win over the others  
14:47 <tmortagne> for example as gdelhumeau told you he does had  sometimes  
14:47 <vmassol> yes but only now not before, right gdelhumeau?  
14:47 <gdelhumeau> note that I don't have then when I use Admin.Export from the admin tools  
14:47 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: for a few weeks  
14:47 <gdelhumeau> I can not remember when it started exactly  
14:48 <gdelhumeau> -then+them  
14:48 <vmassol> well since we use wikistream probabmy  
14:48 <tmortagne> I perfectly remember that we used to have it some time ago too, not just now  
14:48 <gdelhumeau> if Admin.Export does not use wikistream, then yes, probably  
14:50 <vmassol> tmortagne: the change of format is a pain since it means too many diffs. I guess one solution is to run all our xml through it and commit before making any change  
14:50 <tmortagne> vmassol: there is no reason xar:format does not work with it, if it was reading properly the XML it would "fix" it  
14:51 <gdelhumeau> my diff tool allows me to replace all  so it is a pain but not dramaticaly  
14:51 <tmortagne> xar:format does not use stax AFAIK so it should write \r directly  
14:52 <gdelhumeau> or maybe you are talking about the git diff?  
14:52 <tmortagne> I really don't see why xar:format does not support it  
14:52 <gdelhumeau> because I personnaly always export the xar in a temp folder and do the diff manually, before committing  
14:52 <gdelhumeau> \*I do the merge manually actually  
14:53 <vmassol> tmortagne: formatmojo is using dom4j  
14:53 <vmassol> why would it remove the encoded \r?  
14:54 <vmassol> encoded chars are valid xml  
14:54 <tmortagne> you don't understand, it supposed to parse it and end up with a \r in a String  
14:54 <tmortagne> there is no way in XML API to tell that something is escaped  
14:55 <tmortagne> so there is absolutely no reason that when xar:format rewrite the XML it keep it escaped  
14:57 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
14:57 <gdelhumeau1> has joined #xwiki  
14:57 <gdelhumeau1> has quit  
14:57 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
14:58 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: so running mvn xar:format does not fix the issue  
14:59 <tmortagne> then it means xar:format escape \r too  
14:59 <tmortagne> but vmassol say that xar:format does not work at all with it so which one it is ?  
14:59 <vmassol> just fixed a bug in formatmojo, just retesting  
15:00 <vmassol> tmortagne: you're right  
15:00 <vmassol> xar:format fixes the issue  
15:01 <vmassol> cool  
15:01 <tmortagne> stax implementation is a jungle, I don't know if there is any way to force making one implementation the default  
15:03 <tmortagne> trying to find which one is escaping \r, I guess at least we can report them that it's not fun  
15:06 <tmortagne> note that if we apply XWIKI-1543 then we don't care since content won't contain \r anymore  
15:17 <tmortagne> looks like the one that escape \r is woodstox  
15:17 <gdelhumeau> woodstox?  
15:17 <gdelhumeau> an hippie serializer?  
15:18 <vmassol> that's why it encodes eveyrthing :)  
15:18 <tmortagne> woodstox-core-asl-4.1.4.jar to be more precise  
15:18 <tmortagne> the fun part is that this behavior is configurable but it's woodstox custom configuration and of course the default behavior is not the same as the default one  
15:19 <tmortagne> s/default/jvm/  
15:27 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
15:31 <Slashman> has quit  
15:35 <vmassol> guys gtg for 1 hour, be back after  
15:35 <vmassol> (well not right now but in 10 minutes ;))  
15:38 <msmeria> has quit  
15:54 <GuillaumeF> has quit  
16:01 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
16:11 <GuillaumeF> has joined #xwiki

18:05 <vmassol> (verifymojo)

18:05 <vmassol> (when it's empty)  
18:05 <tmortagne> not just comment  
18:06 <tmortagne> but language is a critical element since it's part of the document unique id  
18:08 <tmortagne> there is actually few elements that are not "optimized"  
18:08 <tmortagne> only what is critical for database plumbing  
18:09 <tmortagne> default language and translation are important too to differentiate documents  
18:10 <tmortagne> (and translation is a boolean anyway do it's never really empty)  
18:12 <tmortagne> the first goal of the optimization was to make easier to read test (concentrate on tested values and not systematically getting tons of default values)
